title: Recreating Neural Activity During Speech Production with Language and Speech Model Embeddings
author: Owais Mujtaba Khanday (CIRIC-UGR, University of Granada), Pablo Rodríguez San Esteban (CIRIC-UGR, University of Granada), Zubair Ahmad Lone (GIATM, Visakhapatnam), Marc Ouellet (CIRIC-UGR, University of Granada), Jose A. Gonzalez-Lopez (CIRIC-UGR, University of Granada), ...
relevance_why: The paper explores the use of embeddings from large language and speech models to decode neural activity during speech production, which aligns with my research in generative audio models and neural representation learning.
background: The study investigates how well embeddings from pre-trained speech and language models can reconstruct neural activity recorded during speech generation in the brain.
contribution: This paper introduces the application of Elastic Net regression applied to large-scale model embeddings to achieve high reconstruction accuracy of neural signals related to speech production.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous research typically relied on invasive methods like electrocorticography to decode neural signals but did not effectively use large language models for this purpose.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work differs by leveraging embeddings from self-supervised models, which leads to high accuracy in neural reconstruction without intrusive hardware.

key_innovation: It utilizes advanced deep learning model embeddings as a bridge to decode complex neural signals linked to speech activities, showcasing how machine learning can enhance our understanding of human cognition.
real_world_impact: The findings could significantly advance the development of speech neuroprostheses, potentially enhancing communication for individuals with speech impairments.
limitations: The study focuses on specific populations, which may limit the generalizability of the results to a broader audience.

new_terms.neuroprostheses: **Neuroprostheses** are devices engineered to restore or enhance lost functions by interfacing with the nervous system, often aimed at communication in individuals with disabilities.
new_terms.Elastic Net regression: **Elastic Net regression** is a linear regression method that incorporates both L1 (Lasso) and L2 (Ridge) penalties, allowing for better feature selection and multicollinearity management.
